The three fires

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā vuttam arahatā iti me suta
translated: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One:
“Monks, there are these three fires.
What three?

analyzed: rāga aggi dosa aggi moha aggi
translated: The fires of sensuality, ill will, and confusion.

original: ime kho, bhikkhave, tayo aggī”ti.🔽Etamatthaṁ bhagavā avoca.
analyzed: ime kho bhikkhave tayaḥ aggi iti  etam attham bhagavān avoca
translated: These are the three fires.”🔽This is what the Buddha said,
and this is how it’s quoted.
“The fire of sensuality burns people
who are infatuated with sensual pleasures.
The fire of ill will burns those who are malicious,
who kill living creatures.
The fire of confusion burns those who are confused,
who are ignorant of the noble teaching.
Not knowing these three fires,
people delight in identity.
They increase the hells
and the animal realm;
the realm of hungry ghosts,
and they are not freed from Māra’s bonds.
But those who are devoted day and night
to the teaching of the Buddha,
they extinguish the fire of sensuality,

analyzed: niccam asubha saññinaḥ  dosaggim pana mettāya
translated: always perceiving the unattractive.
The supreme people extinguish🔽the fire of ill will with good will,
and the fire of confusion with wisdom
that leads to penetration.
Having extinguished them, being alert,
not lazy all day and night,
they completely attain Nibbāna,
completely overcoming all suffering.
The noble ones who see, the brahmans,
the wise ones who understand correctly,
having directly known the destruction of birth,
do not come back to renewed existence.”

original: Ayampi attho vutto bhagavatā, iti me sutanti.
analyzed: ayam pi atthaḥ vuttaḥ bhagavatā iti me sutam ti
translated: This is the meaning of what was said by the Blessed One, so I have heard.
